news_header: Kosovo Prime Minister Albin Kurti's party, Vetevendosje, is projected to win the most seats in the elections but will need a coalition to govern.
news_original_title: Kosovo ruling party set to come first in election
news_text: Kosovo Prime Minister Albin Kurti's ruling party, Vetevendosje (VV), is set to win approximately 41% of the votes in the recent elections, according to the election commission. This marks a decline from over 50% in 2021, meaning Kurti will need to form a coalition to maintain power. The election was reported to have been conducted without major issues, with a voter turnout exceeding 40%. The Democratic Party of Kosovo (PDK) and the Democratic League of Kosovo (LDK) followed in second and third places, respectively. Kurti aims to strengthen Kosovo's institutions and implement economic reforms, but his actions have raised tensions with ethnic Serbians and Serbia, which does not recognize Kosovo's independence.
